name: Internet, Inc.
description:
This game was created as part of my master's thesis at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln.

Game Overview

Internet, Inc. is designed to teach the Domain Name System (DNS) organizational structure by having the player sort URLs based on the office location. It starts at the web server level with requests for certain web pages. After that, it moves onto DNS server levels to show the resolution of URLs to web server locations.

Controls

This game is a click-and-drag game using the left mouse button to drag. The controls are further explained in-game with graphics.

To exit the game, navigate back to the title screen and select "Quit" or force-quit mid game.
